title: Moving to a different state
body:
within the next week i will be moving to a different state.

this means i am going to have a new ISP a new Router, and a new IP address
(my MAC address will be the same)

as such i am going to need to configure my new router's firewall to allow all the league ports in and out with port forwarding and the like

according to the research i have done 
i need to forward the following ports  for league to work


>     5000 - 5500 UDP (League of Legends Game Client)
>     8393 - 8400 TCP (Patcher and Maestro)
>     2099 TCP (PVP.Net)
>     5223 TCP (PVP.Net)
>     5222 TCP (PVP.Net)
>     80 TCP (HTTP Connections)
>     443 TCP (HTTPS Connections)
>     8088 UDP and TCP (Spectator Mode)

is there anything else i should know or prepare for, for the move or after i arrive?

obviously i need to to pick a new ISP and cable is required, (no way in hell I'm goign to get dial up, dsl , or satellite for gaming)

replies.body: Only other thing I would recommend is using our [hextech repair tool](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/224826367) to automatically configure firewall settings just to make sure nothing is missed.  Nice preparation!
